isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - SHEET METAL REPAIRS - DRILL RIVET PILOT HOLES AND HOLES FOR PLUG WELDS IN NEW PANEL

svcproc.title: DRILL RIVET PILOT HOLES AND HOLES FOR PLUG WELDS IN NEW PANEL

step1.para: Where possible, make a paper template of rivet holes in old panel for laying out the required drilling on new panel. Use existing holes in new panel to align the template.
Center punch rivet hole locations on new panel ( Figure 68).

figure.caption: Figure 68. Using Template To Lay Out Rivet Holes

step1.para: Lay out and center punch the plug weld hole locations along windshield fence (edge) area of new panel (same locations as spot welds).
Drill small pilot hole at each rivet location and plug weld hole location.
Using a 3/8 inch (9.53mm) sheet metal drill bit, drill out plug weld holes in new panel. Do not drill out rivet holes to rivet size until panel is aligned and clamped in place on body.
